stimulusHtml: For which of the following two-dimensional arrays arguments does  countAs  not work as intended?

features.html:
Consider the following method,  countAs,  which is intended to traverse all the elements in the two-dimensional (2D)  String  array  things  and return the total number of elements that contain at least one  "a".  The method does not always work as intended.

 

public static int countAs(String[][] things)
{
   int count = 0;
   for (int r = 0; r < things.length; r++)
   {
      for (int c = 0; c < things[r].length - 1; c++)
      {
         if (things[r][c].indexOf("a") >= 0)
         {
            count++;
         }
      }
   }
   return count;
}

 

For example, consider the following initialization.

 

String[][] order = {{"salad", "soup"},
                    {"water", "coffee"}};

 

The method call  countAs(order)  should return  2.
